values: Melbourne's finest spaz-core party-grinders return this Friday on the extra brutal date of September 11! After 2 years of hiatus Rotten Chop are back, faster, more insane than ever, and ready to blow your skulls off once again. With their debut EP recorded and poised for release, make sure you get down to Pony this Friday to catch them rise from the dead on a bill of truly monstrous proportions: ROTTEN CHOP (comeback show) ORDER OF CHAOS (featuring ex members of Damaged, Blooduster, Earth) A MILLION DEAD BIRDS LAUGHING (fucken amazing abstract grind featuring members of Hatchet Dawn) WITCHGRINDER (awesome new industrial metal act from Travis Everett- Attack, 13 Monkeyz) That's 4 killer bands for 10 measly bucks. See you there!! Price: $8 Date: Friday, September 11, 2009 Time: 8:00pm - 1am Location: Pony Street: 68 Little Collins st City/Town: Melbourne, Australia http://

The time has come! "Back To Zero", the long-awaited debut album by Melbourne theremin-led instrumentalists The Night Terrors, is about to hit stores and blow minds. Recorded with Nao Anzai (Laura, Because of Ghosts, Sinking Citizenship, City City City), Back To Zero is 60 minutes of spaced-out synthesiser rock ranging from haunting synthscapes to flat-out analogue noise. It looks and sounds completely amazing and we goddamn love it. In only a matter of days all the lucky people of the world will be able to share in our love. It'll be coming out on EXO Records and available in stores around Australia and The US for starters. And - because it'll also be available online - you can get it anywhere in THE WORLD! if that's where you happen to live. To celebrate this momentous occasion we're having a massive launch/party at The East Brunswick Club on Friday April 10. Our lovely psychedelic popster friends Richard In Your Mind are coming down from Sydney especially and EXO friends/lovers The Emergency will also be joining us in playing our hearts out for your good selves. Those of you who saw us play last time at The East Brunswick will know that the night will be an epic audio-visual spectacular which will make you thirsty. So if you live in Melbourne town come on down and join us in our celebrations. You can be one of the first people in the world to own a copy of ''Back To Zero''! The time has come! As we plan on becoming quite merry, you could also get the chance to talk to Miles about his theremin boot camp with Lydia Kavina in Oxford and his not-at-all-nerdy three-day theremin festival in Germany! Please note in your diaries, come down and bring your music-lovin' mates, and a few extra clams for a record or two and a highly sexual Night Terrors t-shirt! (GOOD) FRIDAY 10TH APRIL @ EAST BRUNSWICK CLUB THE NIGHT TERRORS (ALBUM LAUNCH) RICHARD IN YOUR MIND (SYD) THE EMERGENCY East Brunswick Club: 280 Lygon St East Brunswick, Melbourne, Victoria, Australia $13 on the door, 8 30pm start.

Hey there lovelies, The Night Terrors return to the live circuit next weekend with three bodacious shows in Melbourne and Sydney to tanatalise your post-prog synth noise tastebuds! They'll be showcasing a whole heap of brand new songs from the as-yet-untitled upcoming album they've been locked away recording for the last few months, PLUS this will be the first public airing of their hot new "maternity leave" touring lineup. FRIDAY 20TH JUNE - Melbourne THE NIGHT TERRORS KIDS WITH GUNS FOR HANDS HOTEL WRECKING CITY TRADERS @ PONY, 68 Little Collins St. Melbourne, VIC, 9pm, $6 Come down to Pony for a night of crazy psychedelic noise and prog rock mayhem on Friday 20th June, as The Night Terrors head up a lineup of Melbourne's finest smartass bands. This promises to be one mind-warp of a night - also on the bill are the awesome Kids With Guns For Hands and the brutal Hotel Wrecking City Traders. It's going to be bloody wicked. 8 30pm doors, Terrors on around 11pm. SATURDAY 21ST JUNE - Sydney THE NIGHT TERRORS PROWLER (REV. KRIS HADES, HELLEN ROSE, JULIE KIM) BAIN WOLFKIND @ HELLEN ROSE SCHAUERSBERGER LABRATORIUM, Level 1, 17 Waterloo St, Surry Hills, NSW, 8pm, $13 Next the Terrors descend upon the Hellen Rose Schauersberger Labratorium (Level 1, 17 Waterloo St, Surry Hills) on Saturday the 21st of June for an evening of horror-schlock mayhem with support from Prowler (Rev. Kris Hades, Hellen Rose, Julie Kim) and Bain Wolfkind. Bring your capes and blood capsules! SUNDAY 22ND JUNE - Sydney RICHARD IN YOUR MIND THE NIGHT TERRORS WINDSOR FLARE @ THE HOPETOUN HOTEL, 416 Bourke St Surry Hills, NSW Then its over to The Hopetoun on Sunday the 22nd to hop on board good friends Richard In Your Mind's Sunday Residency series, with able support from Windsor Flare! Come on down and get terrified Sunday evening styleee! Then we drive back down the Hume like crazy people! We'd love to see you at whichever of these shows you can get to! love Miles + The Night Terrors xoxoxoxox

FRIDAY 20TH JUNE @ PONY: THE NIGHT TERRORS + KIDS WITH GUNS FOR HANDS + HOTEL WRECKING CITY TRADERS.

Come down to Pony for a night of crazy psychedelic noise and prog rock mayhem on Friday 20th June, as The Night Terrors head up a lineup of Melbourne's finest mind-warping bands, showcasing their hot new songs and introducing their rad new synth wrangler!

This will be the first opportunity to check out brand spanking new material from the Terrors' upcoming record, as well as their sexy new "maternity leave" touring lineup.

Also on the bill are awesome progsters Kids With Guns For Hands and the brutal Hotel Wrecking City Traders. It's going to be bloody wicked.

9pm start, Terrors on at 11.30pm, PONY 68 Little Collins St, Melbourne

Hey there!

Come on down to the Make It Up Club at Bar Open this Tuesday night and see the debut show of a brand new trio:

Chris Hale (Christopher Hale Ensemble, Velure, Tim Rogers Band, millions of other things) - six-string guitar-bass

Miles Brown (The Night Terrors, Dan Kelly & The Alpha Males, general theremin slut) - theremin

Phil Collings (millions of jazzy things, owner of truly awesome name) - drums

This will be a 100% improvised set, and should be an interesting branching out from comfort zones for all three members!

This will also mark the first time in 14 years that Miles and Chris have shared a stage together - the last time being the 1992 year 7/8 social at St. Virgil's College in Hobart. They played Gunners covers. They wore bandanas. Mike Noga (The Drones) was on the drums and stagediving. It was totally rad.

We're hoping for at least three of those elements to be present in this show!

Make It Up Club kicks off at 8pm, and it's $10 / $5 concession.

love Miles

Tuesday, May 27, 2008 at 9:00pm

Location:	Bar Open

317 Brunswick St Fitzroy, Melbourne, Australia

After many moons sequestered on the gloomy distant planet of southern Australia, The Night Terrors finally bring their theremin-fueled synth rock mayhem back to Sydney-town, in support of their new internet single ''Righteous''. Spawned from the festering miasma of the Melbourne underground scene, The Night Terrors' blistering electro-noise has been petrifying punters since the year 2000. Their formula of thunderous metal-bass, breakneck drumming, vintage horror synth and the manic wail of the theremin has earnt the Terrors a reputation as one of Australia's most unusual and original bands. With a drummer returned from 3 years in Paris, a rockin new synth wrangler (Marika Bardin - LoveCutsKill), more theremin than you can poke an aerial at and a brand spanking new set of killer tunes, The Terrors live to do nasty things to your brain once again in 2007. They'll be hitting the stage TWICE for Labour Day Eve on Sunday the 30th September: first off with an early all-ages show at Warehouse Showroom, 9 Bridge St Rydalmere, as part of a sensational bill also featuring the almighty Spod, Hand me My Jetpack and Spun Rivals! (3pm start, $10) Then, that whole lineup teleports to the Oxford Art Factory, 38 Oxford St Darlinghurst, for an all-out over-18s mind-blowing spectacular, with The Laurels joining in for good measure! (8pm start, $12) It's going to be bloody fantastic!!! www.thenightterrors.com

Hiii everyone! We are really really excited to be launching our new single "Righteous" on Saturday night at the Tote Hotel! This is the first new Night Terrors material to make it out of the haunted holiday camp where we write and record all our music, and it's fresh as a daisy and more overblown than a year 7's first trumpet!!! It has like a million theremin tracks on it! And a bloody choir!! Check it out on our myspace page HERE, and if you are able, we'd love for you to come down and celebrate with us on Saturday night! The lineup is fan-frickin-tastic! Joining us will be the master of sexxxiness, all the way from the windswept peaks of Sydney: SPOD, in his first Melbourne show in bloody ages! Also playing are the splendiferous Red Light Union, and make sure you get down early to catch the awesome nutsoid radness of Love Is Science Fiction!! Plus DJ Rawk playing really choice tunes in between sets! EXTRA SPECIAL BONUS!!! The first 100 payers will receive a free CD featuring our new single "Righteous" PLUS Spod's latest track "So Exciting" PLUS another new Night Terrors track "Suspended Animation" AND a remix of Spod's new song!!! That's 4 songs of super wickedness!!Just for you! The Tote is on the corner of Johnston and Wellington Sts in Collingwood, and it's $10 on the door, 8.30pm start, and The Night Terrors are on at midnight! Hey all you radical dudes, The Night Terrors play two awesome shows this weekend just 4 U!! First up, for all you southsiders, and northsiders who aren't afraid of trolls, The Night Terrors will be hitting the stage at ye olde Revolver Upstairs as part of Mushroom Giant's huge EP launch this Friday the 25th May! This going to be one hot-ass bill with the spectacular Mushroom Giant celebrating the release of their hot new rekkid, plus The Night Terrors - rejuvinated, theremin-wielding and ready for action, hot young things Love is Science Fiction and Alaska Ratio opening things up, plus there's some rad exhibition opening earlier on as well. So if you like your art rocky, and your rock quite arty, this will be all the way up your alley. Plus, after the gig you'll be at Revolver, which is its own particular brand of party-out insanity, if you're into that kind of thing. $10 on the door, Terrors on at 10.45pm Revolver upstairs, Chapel St. Prahran. THEN>>> ...The Night Terrors continue their triumphant resurrection campaign with a super-late club show on Saturday 26th May @ dv8, CBD Nightclub, Mackillop St. Melbourne City. Also on the bill are hot goth rockers Schadenfreude and Red Light Union, plus DJs Lobotomy and Dorian. All you kids who love running around trashed at nightclubs listening to blisteringly loud tunes until the sun comes up, this show is tailor-made for you. Everyone else, dust off the Doc Martins and come down for a few million drinks and whip out those dance moves that you can't really get away with at Pony. Gig starts at midnight, Terrors on around 2am.

The Night Terrors launch into their first show for the year this Friday 26th of January at the Rob Roy. With their brand new album finally completed(!), the Terrors are gearing up for a massive 2007, and will kick it off in style with a huge show featuring a completely killer lineup, the entirety of which will be recorded live for release as part of the Cumbersome Sessions!

Joining the Terrors will be awesome young fuzz-rockers Puppetman, petrifying no-wavers Sinking Citizenship and hot new hipsters Bang! Bang! AIDS! This is going to be one awesome show of left-of-centre local original rock, so if you're up for something exciting and mildly intelligent to top off your (anti)patriotic festivities, we'd love you to be there! Plus you can roll up and have your screams and hollers immortalised on tape! woooooo

Theremin, horror synth, art-rock and a public holiday! Yeeehaarrrr!! It's almost as exciting as when the teachers yelled out "Extra Play" at lunchtime in primary school.

Love and kisses,

The Night Terrors

Ok! So its time to dust of ye olde lj and post some shenanigans!! Last few weeks have been pretty goddamn awesome, have just been hangin with cool people and doing crazy things, seeing lots of cool art and generally chillin'. Nice to have a break from Nigh Terrors for a while, the Rotten Chop album is half done, and Dustbunny has been playin some kikass shows! Yaaaaayyy!! Last Tuesday dragged me away from theremin scales hell and out so see Dry Kill Logic at the Evelyn, gotta admit I wasnt expecting this to be awesome but it totally was!! Support bands Mammal and Sydonia were ok, but Dry Kill Logic fucking ruled!! Awesome playing, awesome show, and 4 of the biggest guys I've ever seen in real ife! Holy craP!! Cat and I had an awesome time headbanging, moshing and generally being \m/etal!! Then we went home and made frozen pizzas and drank softdrink and laughed at the tv!! Yayyyy!! Thankyou Cat for an fantastic night!! Friday night had Dustbunny rehearsal, then went cruising with Cat around Port Smelbourne, drinkin slurpies, listening to metal and talking about life - totally rad! The dropped down to Cabaret Nocturne's new venue - which is completely awesome - SOOOOO much better than Dream! Better layout, better vibe, beer on tap!! Yeehar had a very funny night watching Jan take his gear off and ppl generally being trashwhores! Saturday was ye olde day of stupidly massive houseparty, thanks to James Dodd and Ha-Ha and their lovely housemeats. Dustbunny played to a packed out room of psychotic street artists, metal heads, hip-hoppers, goths, artists and Fitzroy-livers, and the place went bananas!! One of the best parties in ages, sooo huge, have no idea how many ppl were squeezed into that tiny place!! Crazy Crackwhores Zoe and Regan, and moi. Moya and Clint lookin photogenic She of the voice that kill angels and he of the emerging art career!! Clint and I looking sober Dancefloor Jesus and Friends Jimmy James and I discussing the finer points of thermodynamics. Some fuckin dudes Me explaining to Lindsay why I couldnt stand to live with him Vee and I imitating tha claymation series Red and Blue A nasty case of pout. Yeah, we totally hate eachother, clearly. :D Roh and Clint bonding over emo haircuts. Rick reminding everyone why he wore a mask That windswept look wrong button Some randoms talking about subcultural appropriationism Mr. Paul looking so very South Yarra in the face Me explaining the term "South Yarra in the face" The winner of the "put your balls in the fire" competetion. "It'll look hotter if I lie on the ground..." god knows what was going on here... Nadine trying to crack onto the chair's boyfriend Confused randoms Girl with hottest hair since ever! Random cutey Drunk at this point Clearly very drunk... Cat using her line about the stairway to heaven The stairway to heaven Ok, so what is actually happening here is some poor party attendee desperately needed a surface to project a film of some very important footage foir soemone else - it was a matter of life and death...we were just being decent citizens, certainly not easily persuaded trashbags being manipulated by our evil female freinds, no sireee....

If you are in the mood for hotness this Friday night, there is but one place you need to be - Cabaret Nocturne's 3rd Birthday bash @ Dream Nightclub!! The reason? DUSTBUNNY - the breakbeat-noise-scuzz-metal-industrial-goth-nudist-hyperactive-A.D.D-trash extravaganza will be mounting (!) the stage for a set of mind-retarding pupil-dilating silliness!!!! Featuring members of The Night Terrors & Rotten Chop, and fronted by the imitable Miss Cat, Dustbunny blew the heads off all who attended the Crazy Warehouse Parties of last summer, and bring their over-sexed bedlam back this Friday night, especilally 4 U!! Expect crazy breakneck beats, inappropriate nudity, questionable musicianship, excessive consumption of passion-pop and a stage show that'll leave you quivering!! Make sure to get down to the venue early to get trashed in front of the first band: goth-haircut-sporters Shadenfreude, then present thyself to the front of the stage to be showered in Dustbunny goodness at 10 30pm!!! After that you can enjoy the poundin' electro of Mr. David Thrussel and SNOG!! Then drunkenly careen around the venue til dawn to the strains of DJs with incongruous names such as Lobotomy, Thomas, Jay, pH, Kosta and Ange!! Love Miles aka GlitterSprinkleBunny CHECK OUT OUR TUNES AT: http://www.myspace.com/dustbunnyband CABARET NOCTURNE 3RD BIRTHDAY FRIDAY 18TH AUGUST @ DREAM NIGHTCLUB, 229 QUEENSBERRY ST CARLTON / CITY, DOORS 9PM, TIX $12

The Night Terrors bring their theremin-fueled synth-prog mayhem back to the Tote for an evening high-octane horror on Saturday the 12th of August! With a killer new album almost completed and a blistering live show that has been melting the minds of Melbourne audiences, the Terrors have been going from strength to strength recently, and this will be their absolute last show before hiding away to complete their recording. This will also be their final show with monster drummer Renato Vacirca, who, after sweating away behind the rock-kit for many a killer show, is moving on to explore jazzier pastures. Don't miss this chance to send him off in style! Joining the Terrors on the night will be red-hot rocksters Taste the Venom!, rock-scuzz punkers Angry Kid and experimental newcomers Kids With Guns For Hands, PLUS The Diamond Dolls burlesque troupe in between bands! That's one killer night's entertainment! BE THERE! SATURDAY 12TH AUGUST @ THE TOTE, CNR WELLINGTON AND JOHNSON STS, COLLINGWOOD. THE NIGHT TERRORS TASTE THE VENOM! ANGRY KID KIDS WITH GUNS FOR HANDS + DIAMOND DOLL BURLESQUE!!

The Night Terrors spook up the stage one last time this Saturday night at Pony, before hiding away to put the finishing touches on their brand new album! The record is almost finished and already sounding super-hottt, and the band will be showcasing spanking new tunes from it at this show!

Joining them on the night will be the hot Transvision-Vampism of Nikita & The Snakes, sleaze-rockers Taste The Venom!, plus Skybomber & The Diamond Doll Burlesque Troupe between bands. It's sure to be an evening of high-energy mayhem, plus it's your last chance to catch the Terrors for a while - so come along and shake off those winter shoes!

SATURDAY THE 24th OF JUNE @ PONY

NIGHT TERRORS
12.30am - 1.10am

The Night Terrors emerge from preproduction on their new album to play two killer shows this weekend. First up they join an absolutely stellar lineup on Friday night for the Arthouse's 15th Birthday celebrations, with The Nation Blue, Grand Fatal, Left Hand Cuts The Right & Decarlow. Then its off to Pony on Saturday night for a headline show with Moggs (USA), Actor/Model & Dane Certificate. Don't miss these shows as they will be your last chance to catch the Terrors' theremin infused synth mayhem before they disappear into the studio!

The Night Terrors, Flesh Vs. Venom, Twitch of the Death Nerve & Bar McKinnon (Mr. Bungle) Big Band, this Sat @ Rob Roy
The Night Terrors return to old stomping ground The Rob Roy on Saturday the 25th of March for an evening of art-rock horror! With a new album in the works and a killer new set, the Terrors will be in full flight for this show, one of the last before they disappear into the studio. Joining them on the night will be the inimitable anarchy of Flesh Vs. Venom, plus the crazy antics of Twitch of the Death Nerve & a special appearance by the Bar McKinnon (ex Mr. Bungle!) Big Band to open. 9pm start, $9.

Okay kiddoes, the time has finally come, strap on your most absorbant plastics and get yourselves down to:
Crazier. Warehousier. And much, much Partier.
Anyone who came to the last party will know it was MASSIVE - we counted around 400 heads! This one is gonna be even better. More bands, real DJs, non-winter weather! Band wise, we got the awesome Industrial Electroness of international sensations ANGEL THEORY, the scintillatingly brutal death metal of RESISTICA, mind-blowing idiot-savant scuzz from ROTTEN CHOP, PLUS the debut performance by brand new goth-noise-break-porn offensive DUSTBUNNY!!!! PLUS DJs Toupee, Pete Kung and Phlexmartian spinning crazy tunes all bloody night. Sound exciting? It is! Best part is - it's open invitation - bring your mates, tell them to bring theirs.
DETAILS: Crazy Warehouse Party #2 Date: Saturday 18th of March Address: 100 Gore St. Fitzroy Time: 9pm - R.I.P. BYO anything and anyone you like!!

The Night Terrors hit the stage at brand new independent music venue PopShop Gallery this Saturday night for Lost & Found, with Barrage and Lost & Found DJs, at 18 Corrs Lane Melbourne (just off Little Bourke St.) from 10pm!

*************************************** The Night Terrors continue their campaign of world Theremination as they bring their spooky synth-prog-noise anarchy back to the Arthouse this Friday night. Come and see them road-test brand new tunes for their new album which is due mid-year. Joining the Terrors will be the awesome Brisk (ACT), the thunderous Whitehorse and Shagnum. 9pm start! *************************************** FRIDAY 10TH FEB - THE ARTHOUSE THE NIGHT TERRORS + BRISK (ACT) + WHITEHORSE + SHAGNUM, 9PM ***************************************

Ok, so enough with the peace, love, empathy and fluffy bunnies, The Festive Season is finally over, and now it's time for some good old fashioned BRUTALITY. If you love Metal and all its little goblins, and I have a feeling you do, then it's really very simple. This Saturday, put on your finest black clothing, grab your evil mates, consume some invigorating substances, and give your beautiful mane a brush in preparation for WINDMILL ACTION!!!

Rotten Chop have been sharpening their "instruments" all summer and are ready to cut you to bits! New songs, new moves, new haircuts! For what more couldst thou ask? How about local godfathers of scuzz Beanflipper??!!!!!
Christ, yes.

Saturday 21st Janury 2006 - The Arthouse, cnr Queensberry & Elizabeth Sts. City. 

BEANFLIPPER

ROTTEN CHOP

LA HAINE

STRICT VINCENT

9pm start.
